website_summaries.verdict: A fun ninja backyard obstacle course with overall objectives you can set up in a few minutes and use as an adult.
pros: 250 pound weight capacity makes it suitable for children and adults alike
Varied obstacles can be placed anywhere along the slack line for a unique training or play experience
cons: Confusing directions can make the installation process more difficult
Not ideal for temporarily setting the obstacle course up

customer_reviews.title: Works with 6x6 posts too!
customer_reviews.text: Can be done with 6x6 posts. New house so no trees. I was worried it wouldn’t work, too much tension, but works fine for my kids 12, 10, & 7 yrs old. Obviously works better around large healthy trees, but this setup in our backyard works great! I sunk 12’ 6x6’s about 4’ deep, they bow a bit with the heavier kids or multiple kids, but no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Wood already broken after 1 month outside
customer_reviews.text: I like the product BUT the wooden pieces are already breaking after 1 month outside. Id like to return it for a replacement to see if this is a one time thing or there is a design problem. In terms of the ninja line the kids like it.
customer_reviews.author: Janine R

customer_reviews.title: Overall, lots of fun for years come
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Seems very strong and able to withstand a lot of abuse. The grips are great and the kids are having a lot of fun with it. The ratchet worked well (after I read the instructions on releasing it :) The not as good: The length of the webbing where one can place the hanging grips was shorter than I expected. The obstacles only went 2/3 of the distance between the trees in our yard. Also, it took some serious work to get the carabiner's through the opening in the webbing, at least the first time. Overall, lots of fun for years come
customer_reviews.author: Lamedeity

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Slackers purchase. I am very impressed with the quality of their gear. This ninja line has 2 layers of webbing throughout the entire line that are sewn together with spaces left for the 'biners to slide through. The ratchet is strong enough to easily tension the line in a few seconds. We had it out of the box and up to use in 20 minutes. The most difficult part was getting the 'biners through the pockets. We found it much easier to do with a lot of slack in the line. There are 5 extra pockets to add more stuff. We added a rope ladder, the spinning wheel and a climbing rope.
customer_reviews.author: tylioromiosaurus

customer_reviews.title: Grand Kids had a blast
customer_reviews.text: The grand kids, 9, 11, and 13 really have fun with this. They like to watch the "American Ninja" show and this gives them a chance to see what they have in them. They have a blast with this and that promotes some good physical exercise. That means I like it too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: its ok. kind of flimsy and smaller than it ...
customer_reviews.text: its ok. kind of flimsy and smaller than it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Super fun for ninja warriors
customer_reviews.text: This is a blast! My six year old loves it - we hung it between two posts next to his tree house and he uses it multiple times a day. Every kid who comes to our house immediately goes for the ninja line. It was fairly easy to install. The only thing we noticed is that there’s a lot of slack when my son actually uses it. We should have installed higher posts so it could have been higher. In the middle, his feet touch the ground.
customer_reviews.author: NewlyWoodwards

customer_reviews.title: Kid magnet for the neighborhood!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this thing! I have 6 and 8 year old girls and all the neighborhood kids come to play on it.as well. When they are done with it, it is easy to take down and move. Buy the two styles of rope ladders to go with it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Such an awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved everything about this product!! Was the hit of our camping trip! The kids had endless fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Corey B.

customer_reviews.title: ... the zip line from slackers so this was a wonderful addition to our backyard obstacle course
customer_reviews.text: We have the zip line from slackers so this was a wonderful addition to our backyard obstacle course.
customer_reviews.author: John and Diane Boake

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 10 seconds!
customer_reviews.text: One wooden handle failed within 10 seconds of my son using in for the first time causing him to fall and hurt himself!
customer_reviews.author: LauraLawford

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is so much fun! My kids play on this (and the slackline) everyday. The adults love it too. Note: You do have to hang it a little high for adults since there will be some give in the center of the line.
customer_reviews.author: Blank

customer_reviews.title: Really fun toy and easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old desperately wanted monkey bars in our backyard. This worked instead. Really fun toy and easy to put up. Just wish it had a few more grabbers to attach. Appears they are easy to buy separately. Also the tree wrap should be purchased - not included.
customer_reviews.author: anne e haddad

customer_reviews.title: My daughter said this is the best gift that she has ever gotten
customer_reviews.text: My daughter said this is the best gift that she has ever gotten! Tons of fun for all kids Would highly recommend getting the climbing rope to go with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: our kids love this thing, we have an 8,10,11 year old and all of them enjoy it. When we have parties all the kids enjoy it even the 13 year old. Attach to two strong trees and your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Brian N.

customer_reviews.title: The neighborhood kids or come over to play on this ...
customer_reviews.text: The neighborhood kids or come over to play on this ninja course. Boys and girls.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Jay

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Have this for a few months now. Kids and even adults get a kick out of using this. I’m surprised how well it holds up. I leave it up all the time and so far so good. Tension stays really strong as well. Better than my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts- have to return
customer_reviews.text: Looks super cool, but ours came WITHOUT the actual ninja line and we were t able to put it up for Christmas. Very disappointed. Have to return and wait for a new one with our fingers crossed that it has all of the parts this time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great kit - bought for my 5 year old in ...
customer_reviews.text: Great kit - bought for my 5 year old in the backyard - it's challenging but he loves it. Given his height it's low to the ground, which makes it very difficult for my 10 year old to use - but that's to be expected. Wish I had more trees to string up a 2nd line higher up for him!
customer_reviews.author: BRS

customer_reviews.title: kids love
customer_reviews.text: have not even set it up outside yet, used the pieces on the rafters in the basement..kids love it
customer_reviews.author: DMW

customer_reviews.title: This line saved my roof!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this kit. We added the climbing rope for Christmas. I want to say, though, that we are very grateful for our Ninja line. We had some freakish snow storms in March this year which dumped a lot of snow on us. One day there was a terrible crash and a pine tree crashed into the house. The amazing thing is that the pine tree was connected by the ninja line to another tree which held the pine back enough that it didn't crash through the roof or any of the windows!
customer_reviews.author: L. Martinka

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. Easy to install and take down. Directions are clear and easy to follow. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Applebee

customer_reviews.title: Ninja tested-Dad approved
customer_reviews.text: My little ninja loves it...lots of accessories to add on as well
customer_reviews.author: William T Sobolewski

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it! I mistakenly purchased the small length and ...
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it! I mistakenly purchased the small length and had to buy the extension. I wish they sold the long line separately.
customer_reviews.author: gogo

customer_reviews.title: Almost there
customer_reviews.text: I like it but my kids don't really hard to get across for kids hurts their hands
customer_reviews.author: candiece

customer_reviews.title: All of my kids (ages 9-15) enjoy using it
customer_reviews.text: Although you need to account for a buildup in strength to begin using it, my son LOVES it! All of my kids (ages 9-15) enjoy using it. Can't wait to collect all of the different attachments as they progress. BEST GIFT EVER!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberli Alston

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: We messed up when installing this for the first time, and reached out to the company for help. They were incredibly responsive and helpful, and even ended up sending us a replacement part (because of our mistake) free of charge. The item itself is well-made and easy to set up (once we figured out the ratchet).
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. O'Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. I don’t see how my 7 and 9 year olds will be able to reach to cross.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My Granddaughter loves this. It is exactly what it says it is. Very well put together.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy A. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Strong and longggg
customer_reviews.text: I installed it inside my boys rooms, in a parkour area. Is just what I expected but... it would be better if you could choose between different lenghts.
customer_reviews.author: NADIA MICHEL

customer_reviews.title: Get one with just all rings.
customer_reviews.text: Kid didn't like it at all. The rings, which there are only two of were the only part of it she could do. I'd suggest one with all rings.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Keep kids active
customer_reviews.text: Bought for kids ages 8 and 9. They struggle but it’s good for them.
customer_reviews.author: Chad S.

customer_reviews.title: That's good. They will work hard to be successful at ...
customer_reviews.text: My 7, 9, 11 and 13 year old grandkids tried this out a few weeks ago. They are athletic but had a difficult time with these. That's good. They will work hard to be successful at this.
customer_reviews.author: John L McCavit

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and the kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and the kids love it. Customizable so you can change the obstacles no getting board.
customer_reviews.author: JuleDragon

customer_reviews.title: Fun and hard... BUT still Fun
customer_reviews.text: Everyone in the family loved trying this. We had to pull our kids away so they could rest their arms. I highly recommend for the Ninja Warrior in your family.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMina

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my yard which has a lot of trees but no space for a play structure!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. My kids love them. Built a ninja warrior course in the basement. Has been fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: E. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: great exercise
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids love this and it helps keep them from spending the days playing video games.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Missing items from the box
customer_reviews.text: The monkey balls were missing out of the box. It came quickly but when my son went to put it together all the parts weren’t in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Uma

customer_reviews.title: Great product - harder than it looks.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up. I just had to attach each hanging apparatus to the slack line first. It fits nicely between the two trees that I have in the backyard. Now that we've installed playground wood chips underneath for safety, I will be putting it up higher so the adults can use it too. It is very hard...we are really working on our grip strength to be able to complete this. My 9 year old daughter has been able to get half way across. Now that it's starting to warm up, we'll be able to practice more and hope to report that we can complete it.
customer_reviews.author: Alice S

customer_reviews.title: Love it, easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, love it, love it. Very easy to put up. Not so easy to get the obstacles where I wanted them, but ultimately I did. I had intended to have the slackers rope latter attached to one end, however the rope latter doesn't work with this. Instead, I've got the starting position low so my little people can reach and it slopes up as you go, ultimately taking them up about three feet where they can drop off. I also bought a different type of attachment to use instead of the rope knots and trapeze bars. I got some triangular shaped monkey bar hardware and used the slackers carabiners.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJoe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The grand children enjoy this set and was easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My grandson requested this for his Christmas present. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flexible
customer_reviews.text: Tried for the first time today - awesome setup! Make sure you have a couple mature trees within 36 feet of each other. We have a couple of pine tree about 25 feet which worked. Trees sway a little while I was climbing on the Ninja line but my daughter tore it up and the line barely flexed. Great flexibility to move attachments around. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Old Fashioned Fun
customer_reviews.text: We are the hit of the neighborhood with this. My kids and their friends love it and have enjoyed playing on it for 5 months. It is definitely worth the money as it is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Lady

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my kids and its hard for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids and its hard for them to use. It's hard to anchor it down with out having too much slack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Son Loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 9 yo son is a American Ninja Warrior fan. He wanted to get this and begin his training. He loves it, although its tough.
customer_reviews.author: Golfer 1973

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as expected, but held up fine.
customer_reviews.text: Quite challenging for young kids - would have preferred to have some type of balls instead of the knots. Overall, fine, but Be sure there is something soft beneath for the spills. No one could get past the knots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: It was missing 2 parts. We contacted the manufacturer who immediately shipped us the missing pieces. Great product and great customer service. My kids love this.
customer_reviews.author: KJHPAC

customer_reviews.title: Great challenge
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and we'll made. Took this to camp for the kids to try out. Purchased a rope to cli.b up to the line on. Kids really enjoyed it
customer_reviews.author: Coop

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The kids love it.. just remember to read the directions and install accessories BEFORE set up.
customer_reviews.author: Paige D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We are so excited to hang this in our yard between trees for our ninja eight-year-old!
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, would like to see more of a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, would like to see more of a variety of different things, but the kids love it and use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great quality/ However will only fit smaller trees
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the product is great. However, its made to fit around a tree diameter of 12in-24in at the most. If your trees are wider it will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Russell H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for little ninjas!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old absolutely loves this. Easy to adjust the height and location. Nice that we can rearrange the different attachments to keep it interesting. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mom2con

customer_reviews.title: A Great Fun Challenge for the Kids
customer_reviews.text: The kids and I love this and it's been quite the challenge for them (and me). We hang it between two trees in the yard and love the fact that it's easy to take down and store in the garage when not in use. The company is also great to deal with - communication was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: D B

customer_reviews.title: Great concept!
customer_reviews.text: Very cool product for the ninja warrior want to be. It is easy to set up, but you have to have 2 trees that are separated in distance by the length listed in instructions. It took us a while to find a combination of trees that would work. It is much harder for the kids than I thought it would be, but they love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This did not work for us at all. The ...
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for us at all. The line was way too slack and no amount of tightening would make up for it. My child is only 50lbs and even starting at about 9 ft off the ground when he was hanging from it his feet would touch the ground. unfortunately we had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

product_meta.title: Slackers NinjaLine 36' Intro Kit
product_meta.description: Train like a Ninja with the patented b4Adventure NinjaLine 30' Intro Kit with seven hanging obstacles. This kit allows the versatility of moving the obstacles further apart as your skills improve as well as includes obstacles that vary in skill level. Easy to install and take down means that you can take your training with you. Includes: storage bag for easy portability, 30' x 2" slackline webbing with steel ratchet and rubberized grips, a three piece 10" nylon rope Monkey Fist, a two piece 16" Monkey Bar Hold, and two piece gymnastics rings with textured grips. All obstacles include steel hanging delta safety clips. Hang in between two posts or healthy trees.
feature_bullets: Ninja Training with seven obstacles including: a three piece 10" x 2.5" nylon rope knows, two piece 16" monkey bar holds with triangle safety carabiners, and two gymnastics rings with textured finish
Hang 30' 2" Slackline webbing between two posts or healthy trees
Ages 6 and up, Max weight 250 lbs; Adult supervision required

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars230 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
